This is his 3rd loan with MFP and he committs to paying on time.  He shares that he enjoys working with his communal bank, " Nuevo Amanecer de Huacamayo" ( New dawn of Huacamayo), due to their cooperation and the enjoyable meetings with members.
The money from this loan will be vested towards cleaning his land where he will spend around 800 soles for each on manual labor, the rest will be used to purchase fertilizer.

loans.use: to invest in the clearing of his plots, he would invest around 800 soles for each one to pay personnel, the rest would be utilized to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put a better roof on his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Apisa

texts.en:
Apisa is 50 years old. She is married and has three clever children. All of them are in university. Her elder daughter studies in a foreign country, while her two small daughters study in their native town.

Apisa's work in education requires much sacrifice and follow-through in teaching. Apisa works as teacher of foreign languages at a school teaching youngsters of various ages where she impacts knowledge with dignity. Her main concern is educating these people since they are future of the nation and improve standards of living. She has worked in this way for more than 33 years and has big experiences. Her salary from teaching is small and it is not enough to pay for daughter’s study at the university. She is asking for a loan of 4000 Tajikistani somoni (TJS). She will pay for her second daughter’s study at the university. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for study at the university.

loans.name: Sarwa Wiguna Group

texts.en:
Ni Ketut succeeded in maintaining her pigs. Her husband supports her business because the results can help to improve the family’s income. She also succeeded in renovating the barn. 

Now she needs a new loan to purchase pig feed for her two sows. Her husband gave her money to support the business and to purchase an additional pig. She hopes the sow will give her healthy piglets and she can sell them to other breeders in her village.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed.

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en: Heng is 54 years old and lives in a rural area of the Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. She is a widowed mother of five children. She makes a living through rice farming on one hectare of farmland. Having been in this business for 29 years, she is able to earn approximately 20,000 KHR per day. She manages to save about 5,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Her main challenge is the low crop yields caused by the drought. Heng’s group is composed of three members. Heng and one other member have been with Kiva partner VisionFund for four loan cycles, while the remaining member has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She has succeeded in improving her family’s livelihood and paying back all the past loans. Now Heng is leading her group to apply for a loan. She is going to use a portion of the loan to pay the harvesting fee for her dry season rice and a portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for her rice planting during the rainy season. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her paddy field so as to set aside some money to purchase extra plots of farmland to expand her farming business.

loans.use: To pay harvesting fees and to buy seed and fertilizer

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: We Are Here Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “We Are Here” group from Kenema, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Mariama is the leader of this group. The 29-year-old is married to a driver and they have 3 children attending primary and secondary schools. Mariama has been a businesswoman for many years now, selling clothes (specifically Bamako clothes: prestigious clothes dyed in Mali). With her share of this loan, she will buy a bale of Bamako clothes to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a bale of Bamako clothes to add to her current stock

loans.name: Suwarti

texts.en:
Suwarti works as an ordinary laborer; her income is uncertain. It depends on the time of planting and harvesting. Suwarti is confused because her son, Arif, needs money to finish school. Arif stayed out of school for one year while Suwarti had no other charges. Suwarti wants to apply for a loan through the student loan program of Kiva, to pay for Arif to finish school. In the picture, Suwarti appears with her son, Arif.

Arif will stay in school for one more year to complete vocational school. He hopes to finish and quickly find work as a computer technician in a company, in order to help his parents and younger siblings and repay the loan to Kiva.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Rom's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Rom is 52 and married. She has five children, including a son who is dependent on her and still in school. She and her husband struggle to feed their child through working for others for a fee to support the family. They have been in this business for ten years. 

Rom received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, a cycle ago, while the other member is just a first-cycle client. Rom completely paid back the loan, which has helped her to support the child’s education. 

Now Rom and her group member are requesting a loan with VisionFund in amount of KHR 200,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to build a decent toilet. She hopes this toilet will promote good health for her family.

loans.use: to build a decent toilet.

loans.name: Mukijah

texts.en:
Mukijah is the mother of Cornelia. Mukijah's job is uncertain, depending on the crops and the weather. During the rainy season, Mukijah cannot work and does not get money. Currently, Mukijah is in need of money for school fees for Cornelia. Cornelia has one more year in school, but Mukijah is worried about an uncertain financial condition. Mukijah is applying to Kiva for a loan through the student loan program to cover the cost of Cornelia's school this year. 

In the picture, Mukijah appears with her daughter, Cornelia.

Cornelia is currently in third grade at the vocational school, staying in school one more year to complete her studies. She hopes to complete the rest of the school year and quickly find work as a professional accountant in order to help ease the burden on her parents.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for the tailoring business.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
Heang is a 28-year-old married woman who resides in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Heang owns a few plots of farmland for cultivating seasonal crops such as rice, corn, and vegetables. She has been doing this alongside her spouse for ages, earning a decent income to support their living needs. 

For additional income, Heang and her spouse also work as a paid laborers on a rubber plantation and get their payment monthly. Their daily tasks are to collect rubber resin from each tree and bring it into a large container. 

This couple is responsible for three children, two of whom are attending a local primary school.

With the loan she has requested through HKL, Heang would like to invest in planting corn on her fields. She will purchase seeds and fertilizers, and pay for a tractor to till the land. It will enable her to keep earning income from her existing land and make her business more viable in the coming season. 

Someday, Heang hopes to attain a quality of life and provide all her children with better opportunities for education.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers, and pay for a tractor to till the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to his residence (plastering and painting among others).

loans.name: Susmini

texts.en:
Susmini is a mother who works as a laborer. Susmini is not young anymore; she has a fear related to the education expenses of their child, Daryati. Their income is only sufficient for the needs of everyday life. For one year longer, Daryati will attend vocational school, and this will continue to cost the family money. Susmini is applying for a loan through Kiva's student loan program for the cost of Daryati's schooling for a year. 

In the picture, Susmini appears with her daughter, Daryati.

Financial administration is Daryati's ideal. She is currently in her third year in the vocational school classes. In one more year, she finishes her schooling; she hopes to finish it because she knows her family is facing very difficult conditions. She wants to finish quickly and be able to help her parents.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is aged 37 and married with five children aged between thirteen and five years. He has twelve years in farming within his rural area in Western Kenya where he lives with the family. His farm produces maize, beans, vegetables, and milk for the local markets. Maize has been his main produce and helps him meet a major part of his family needs.

Timothy has requested a loan of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He hopes he will be able to generate enough income and establish a farm of seven dairy cows within five years. He says the diversification will help improve his farming income, which is usually challenged with seasonal fluctuation in maize prices. He adds that the income will help him a great deal in educating his children.

Timothy is, however, concerned with poor road networks, which make access to other markets expensive. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo’s loan services.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Tarsidik

texts.en:
Tarsidik works as a laborer. His income is very minimal, while he must pay for the six children, which he finds very difficult. Due to the lack of economic resources, three of the children are not in school. Currently, Tarsidik is looking for a way to pay for educational costs for Endang, who is spending one more year out of school. Tarsidik is trying to borrow funds through the student loan program of Kiva, to finance Endang's schooling to completion.

In the picture, Tarsidik appears with Endang, his daughter.

Endang is concerned about the condition of her family, and the expectations of her parents and siblings. Endang is trying to study hard to finish school quickly. Endang's ideal is to be a professional accountant. She wants to quickly get a job to help ease the burden of her parents.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en:
Felipe is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Felipe is providing multi-cab services to transport different kinds of products. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to pay for the maintenance of the multi-cab.

Felipe has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Felipe hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the multi-cab.

loans.name: Moey's Group

texts.en:
Aged 51 years old, Moey is a married mother of nine children living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang. To strive for this big household, she has been planting paddy rice, and her husband works as a construction worker in the local area. They have been in this business for 20 years,earning about 20,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) per day. 

Moey’s group consists of three members who are all females living in the same village. She is on her fifth loan cycle, while her two fellow group members are first loan cycle clients with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She has completely repaid the past loans, which have enabled her to expand her business. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Moey will use her portion to buy rice seeds for her paddy field and to buy construction materials in order to support her husband’s business. She hopes to earn more income so as to improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for her agriculture business and to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Sumaira is a 28-year-old woman living in Punjab, Pakistan, with her three daughters and a son. She is a very hard-working tailor who wants to expand her business. Sumaira and her husband's biggest aim in life is to give higher education to all of their children and to make each of them an independent human being in the future. But, because of financial constraints, it seems difficult for them to turn their dream into a reality. 

Sumaira has applied for a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan for purchasing a new sewing machine so she can stitch up more dresses and satisfy the needs of her clients more professionally. She hopes, with the help of this loan, that she will be able to expand her business and reach her desired net income. That would enable her to provide a quality education to her daughters and son and fulfill all of their basic needs in the future.

loans.use: To purchase a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Kartiwen

texts.en:
Kartiwen works as a domestic servant. Her husband only works as a laborer. Kartiwen had four children. Two of them do not attend school because of economic limitations. Kartiwen hopes only for her first child, who currently sits in the third grade at the vocational school. Kartiwen is applying for a loan from Kiva to help with the school fees of Kaswan. 

In the picture, Kartiwen appears with her son, Kaswan.

Kaswan is the first child of four siblings. He is currently following the internship program of the school's field work program. In this, his last year of attending vocational school, he wants it over and wants to quickly find work as a computer technician in order to help his brothers.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Sumarni

texts.en:
Living in barren and dry mountains, Sumarni does not have any special skills; she just works as a laborer. Income is uncertain, depending on the time of planting, harvest time, and the weather. Sumarni had five children. Only one of them, Niken, currently attends school. Sumarni would love to be able to finish the schooling of Niken, who only has one year to go. So, Sumarni is applying for a loan from Kiva to help Niken finish school. 

In the picture, Sumarni appears with her daughter, Niken.

Niken is a student at the vocational school. She is following the practice part of her schooling in the field. Niken wants to quickly finish school in order to help her parents. She also wants to quickly find work as a professional accountant, in order to help her brothers to continue their schooling.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy textiles for making wedding gowns

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Rijem

texts.en:
Rijem is the mother of Rosihun. Rijem works as a laborer. Her husband has the same job, and her income is limited. Rijem has three children, two of whom are still in school. Currently, Rijem is in need of funds for Rosihun's schooling in the vocational school. Since this is the last year at the vocational school for Rosihun, Rijem is applying for a loan through Kiva's student loan program, to finance Rosihun to finish school. 

In the picture, Rijem appears with Rosihun, her son.

In his last year at this school, Rosihun really wants to utilize the time to learn more diligently. He wants to do this in order to obtain satisfactory results, so that his dream to become a computer technician comes true and so that he can help his parents to ease their burden.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Ngadiyem

texts.en:
Ngadiyem lives in a village which is parched and barren. She works as an ordinary laborer. She has not enough income for her family's daily living expenses, so she finds it very difficult to pay for the additional cost of education for her three children. Ngadiyem wants all her children to go to school and finish--especially Solehudin, as at this time he enters his final year in vocational school. Ngadiyem is trying to participate in the student loan program of Kiva, so Solehudin can finish school. 

In the picture, Ngadiyem appears with Solehudin, her son.

Solehudin is the first child of Ngadiyem. He hopes to finish school and quickly find work as a computer technician in order to help ease the burden on his family and help his younger siblings to continue their education.

loans.use: To pay education fees at a vocational school

loans.name: Sarong's Group

texts.en:
Sarong is 25 years old and married. She lives with her husband and son in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is a rice farmer who has worked four hectares of farmland for several years to make a living. The current business earns her about KHR 30,000 per day to meet her family’s needs. Low crop yields resulting from drought is the main challenge for her business. 

Sarong has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely repaid her first loan. She successfully used the previous loan to relieve her family’s burden and improve her livelihood. Her group consists of three female members seeking a new loan, and she is the group leader. One of her members is a third-time borrower while another one is a first-time borrower. As the leader, Sarong will use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her crop yields in order to achieve her dream of buying a decent motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.en:
Nuriddin is 22 years old. He is young and full of energy. Five years ago he began a business with his father. They are builders and also master furniture craftsmen. Nuriddin and his father are said to have "golden hands" because the furniture they make is very wonderful. Their high-quality furniture attracts a lot of clients, so their business has developing year by year. 

Nuriddin intends to repair their home but he does not have enough money. This loan will help him buy building materials to repair their house. In this way he will provide high-quality living conditions for his family and put an end to their problems with the house.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as wood and cement for repairing his house

loans.name: Nabiya

texts.en:
A beautiful woman by the name Nabiya lives in a house that is in bad condition. Her husband is a kind man who works in Russia and has a very small salary. They have two clever children. Nabiya’s children want to live in the house that has good conditions, but her income from the sewing of national women’s dresses is not enough for it. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 somoni to build a new house because her family needs a big house. She wants to build a house with modern planning. 

In this way, she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. Each month, she will make her payment on time. She awaits your support and mercy. Please, help her and her family if it is possible.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as bricks and cement for building a new house.

loans.name: Daya Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
After successfully repaying the previous loan, Dewa Ayu and the Daya Pertiwi group decided to continue the loan, with each getting 2M IDR (Indonesian rupiahs). She has full support from her husband because it is considered beneficial to the family economy.

Dewa Ayu, who has two children, plans to use this loan to buy four piglets. She'll use her own capital to buy pig feed for six months.

Dewa Ayu is hoping to gain more profit than the previous loan, which only made a profit of 300,000 IDR per month. The loans are helpful to Dewa Ayu to develop the business and, of course, increase the family income.

loans.use: To buy four piglets.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer muy trabajadora y carismática, la cual vive en la ciudad de Camaná, la cual se caracteriza por el desarrollo de su agricultura, en especial por el cultivo de arroz, frejoles, maíz, entre otros; asimismo por la diversidad de su gastronomía en especial por uno de sus platos típicos, el cual es el riquísimo “chupe de Camarones”, el cual es el platillo favorito de Rosa y quien lo disfruta junto a su esposo y sus 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, pero han sido el motor para que ella se esfuerce cada día para salir adelante y con quienes le gusta ver películas cuando dispone de un tiempito libre. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Rosa solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera universitaria.

Con mucho entusiasmo Rosa trabaja como agricultora en su parcela, en la cual ha sembrado frejoles, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas ya que es muy cuidadosa y por ello ella cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y sobre todo por sus ganas de salir adelante.

Rosa está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar abonos y fertilizantes, además de poder pagar el agua para el regadío del cultivo, así de esta manera podrá tener un cultivo en buen estado y tener una buena cosecha, lo que le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos y poder seguir adelante y  luchar para hacer realidad su mas grande sueño:2 Tener una mejor calidad de Vida”.
texts.en: Rosa is a very hardworking and charismatic woman. She lives in the city of Camaná, which is known for its agricultural development, especially for rice, bean, and corn cultivation, among other crops. It's also known for the diversity of its gastronomy, especially for one of its two traditional dishes, the delicious "chupe de camarones" [Peruvian shrimp chowder]. That dish is Rosa's favorite; she enjoys it together with her husband and five children, who are already adults. Her children have been the driving force behind her daily efforts to get ahead, and when she has a little free time, she likes to watch movies with them. Due to her scant economic resources, Rosa only studied through her fifth year of secondary school, but she would have liked very much to attend a university. With great enthusiasm, Rosa works as a farmer on her plot of land, where she has planted beans. She works around ten hours, as she is very thorough. She believes that it's going well for her because of her responsibility and above all her desire to get ahead. Rosa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders; thanks to the help they have offered, she will be able to buy soil amendments and fertilizers. In addition, she will be able to pay for the water to irrigate the crop. That way, she will be able to have a healthy crop and a good harvest, allowing her to improve her income and to continue moving forward and struggling to make her biggest dream—to have a better quality of life—a reality.

loans.use: to purchase soil amendments and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rosario Zelmira

texts.es:
Rosario es una joven de 26 años de edad, ella vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se puede apreciar atractivos turísticos como la laguna de “Huacachina, la cual se ubica en medio de maravillosas dunas, en las cuales se practican deportes de aventura como el samboarding, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial se cultiva la uva, esparrago, pallares, frejoles, entre otros. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre le gusta mucho hacer deporte, especialmente jugar vóley con sus amigas y vecinas de su barrio; asimismo le gusta disfrutar de uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”
Día a día Rosario trabaja como profesora en un colegio de educación primaria de su ciudad, ella enseña el curso de Computación; ella labora alrededor de 8 horas al día y con ello puede colaborar con los gastos de su hogar; ella cree que le va bien en su empleo porque tiene mucha paciencia con los niños y sobre todo porque es responsable y puntual.

Rosario está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá pagar su curso de maestría, ya que quiere seguir especializándose y así poder postular más adelante a un mejor puesto de trabajo, así ella podrá tener mejores conocimientos y sobre todo seguir estudiando y trabajando para hacer su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y ser una mejor maestra”.
texts.en:
Rosario is a young woman of 26. She lives in Ica, a city noted for its warm and inviting climate. Also, one can enjoy tourist attractions such as Huacachina Lake, which is located in the middle of amazing dunes, where adventure sports such as sand-boarding are practiced. As well, farming is carried on, especially the cultivation of grapes, asparagus, lima beans, beans and other crops. 

When she has free time, she really likes to play sports: especially volleyball with her friends and neighbors. As well, she likes to enjoy one of her favorite dishes, which is the very delicious “arroz con pollo” (Peruvian-style rice with chicken).

Rosario works day to day as a teacher in a primary school in her city. She teaches the computer course. She works around eight hours a day, and this way is able to contribute toward the household expenses. 

She believes she is doing well in her job because she she has a great deal of patience with the children, and above all because she is responsible and punctual.

Rosario is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help they have provided, she will be able to pay for her teacher education course. 

She needs to continue specializing in order to be considered for a better position in the future. This way she will be able to have better knowledge and above all keep studying and working in order to realize her greatest dream: To have her own home and to be a better teacher.

loans.use: To pay for teacher education courses.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Juliet has a food/retail shop (or sari-sari store) that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 6,000 Philippines pesos to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Juliet has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Juliet hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for the sewing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es: Efraín es una persona de 34 años de edad, conviviente, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, él y Betty viven en la zona de la Maica parada 10, zona lechera a 8 kilómetros de la ciudad, tienen 6 vacas lecheras y elaboran quesillos para la venta a la rescatista, sólo tienen estudios primarios y los dos nacieron en la zona, necesitan capital de operación para comprar forrajes (cáscara de soya para el alimento de su ganado), es la época donde se almacena para el resto del año.  Ha crecido un poco en su actividad y quiere seguir creciendo para mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su hijos porque vive en un espacio en la casa de sus suegros, quiere comprar el terreno y así poder construir la vivienda, hasta el momento sólo tiene dos habitaciones y siendo albañil él podrá construir sin los costos de mano de obra que son muy altos.
texts.en:
Efrain is 34 years old, lives in a common-law marriage, and has 2 school-age children. He and Betty reside in La Maica zone, at Parada 10, a milk-producing area some 8 kilometers from the city. They have 6 milk cows and make cheese for sale, village to village. Both were born in the zone and have only a primary school education. 

They need operating capital to buy forage (soy bean hulls) to feed their cattle. This is the season when cattle-raisers store feed for the rest of the year. Efrain's activities have grown somewhat and he wishes to continue that growth in order to improve conditions of life for all the family. They live in the house of his in-laws. 

Efrain wants to purchase land and thus be able to construct a dwelling, since currently, his family only has 2 rooms. As a brick layer, he could do the construction himself without the very high costs of hiring laborers.

loans.use: buy forage (soya hulls) for feeding his cattle and growing his dairy business, in order to buy land and construct his own house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a buffalo for her dairy business.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en: Luna is married with two children. She is 38 years old and lives in Rizal, Zamboanga del Sur. Luna owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns 4,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Luna just started with Kiva's partner, GDMPC. In the future, Luna's plan is to save her returns in order to buy another lot of farmland.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta, a 57-year-old mother and resident of Manila, Philippines, is married to Juonito, her business partner; they manage their household while operating the business. At this time, Loretta is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Loreta sells a variety of lace, curtains, and other home trappings, earning a minimum of Php 900 in sales every day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

To help her continue her business operations, Loreta is requesting a Php 10,000 loan to buy more quantities of raw materials such as fabric, thread and other items needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her enterprise.

Loreta hopes her business grows, and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all of her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of merchandise needed in her business.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma, owner of a workshop, lives with his wife and five children. Three of his children are attending school. He opened the business thanks to the support of his wife; together, they had the idea of how they could progress in life. Tsuma's wife is a farmer, while Tsuma sells furniture and timber in his workshop.

He is asking for a loan to buy a power saw and a saw mill, which are necessary to maintain the business. The loan will help him to satisfy the demand of his customers.

Tsuma's aspiration is to have a business that is larger, more profitable, and with a larger customer base, since this will help him be able to give his family a more economically stable life.

loans.use: to buy a power saw and a saw mill

loans.name: Hugo Jean Carlos Yorgo

texts.es:
Hugo es un joven muy trabajador y sobre todo con muchas ganas de salir adelante, tiene 19 años y vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, también encontramos playas hermosas y es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, sus pobladores poseen una habilidad para la preparación de platillos ya que su comida es deliciosa y sobre todo tienen una alegría muy contagiante. Cuando Hugo tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho ver televisión, pero en ocasiones le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos, el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz chaufa con wantan frito”.

Día a día Hugo trabaja como obrero en un taller de mecánico, el labora alrededor de 6 horas al día, ya que por las tardes él se encuentra estudiando en la universidad, el cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

hugo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar materiales para sus estudios como folletos, libros, uniformes, entre otros; así de esta manera el podrá tener los materiales necesarios para poder estudiar y seguir esforzándose en hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar su carrera y tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Hugo is a hard-working youth, and above all, has much desire to get ahead. He is 19 years old and lives in the city of Chincha, known for its warm and welcoming climate. It also has beautiful beaches and is the cradle of grand glories in Peruvian sports. Its residents have a noted ability to prepare dishes; their food is delicious and, above all, they display contagious joy. When Hugo has some free time, he likes to watch TV, but on occasions, he also likes to eat one of his favorite plates, which is the delicious “Chaufa rice with fried wanton”. 

Day after day, Hugo works as a laborer in a mechanic's shop. He works 6 hours a day, then afternoons he studies in the university. Hugo believes that his work is going well because he is very responsible and, above all, he has great desire to get ahead.

Hugo is very grateful to Kiva investors, because thanks to their help, he has been able to buy materials for his studies, such as notebooks, books, and uniforms, among other items. That's how he has obtained the necessary supplies for his studies. And he will continue to exert himself to realize his grand dream: “To complete his career training and have his own house”.

loans.use: buy uniforms, books and notebooks, among other supplies, needed for his university studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the sugar cane

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia, a 49-year old resident of Silanga, Tangub City, has been operating her own piggery business for two years as an aid to the income gained from her husband. She provides for the needs of her three children from the PHP 6,000 she earns monthly.

A member of GDMPC since 2011, Aurelia is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy feeding supplies. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Segunda

texts.en:
This is Segunda, 55, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Antonio, a barangay official, and mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Segunda is a mineral water distributor. She buys mineral water in containers from wholesalers and then sells it by the container (5 gallons per container) for a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue to operate her business, she is requesting a loan of 13,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy more stocks of mineral water to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Segunda dreams of expanding her business and hopes to give a good future to her children through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of mineral water.

loans.name: Sheraly

texts.en:
Sheraly is 28 years old. He is married and the father of two lovely children. His wife is a housewife, and that’s why Sheraly manages with business alone. 

He sells men’s clothes and women’s shoes to earn a living. He has been in the business for 10 years. Through the financial support from Imon International organization, he has managed to grow his business. He dreams of expending his business and becoming prosperous in the future. 

He needs a loan to buy men’s clothes and women’s shoes for new season. He will look for your help.

loans.use: To buy men’s clothes and women’s shoes for new season

loans.name: Naheeda's Group

texts.en:
Naheeda is a 57-year-old housewife.  She lives with her husband, a daughter, and a son in Punjab, Pakistan. 

Since 2007, her husband has had a general store, and he works very hard to meet his family needs. He needs additional capital for the growth of his business.  His wife Naheeda is a member of two-person lending group, and she has requested a loan from KIVA partner BRAC Pakistan. 

With the loan money, her husband can buy a variety of goods for his general store, to satisfy his clients more professionally as well as to increase his savings for the better future of his children.

Naheeda and her husband are very hopeful that the loan will be a lucky and productive one for their family.

loans.use: To buy a variety of goods for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Duo El Retiro Group

texts.es: El Dúo “El Retiro” está conformado por doña Sandra Maribel de 31 años de edad, tiene dos hijos (su nena de 3 años y su hijo de 6 años)  tiene un pequeño local ubicado en Ciudad Vieja, en su local ella vende ropa de vestir para(dama, niños, caballeros)también ella distribuye su mercadería a otras 8 personas que la ayudan a vender y eso hace que ella pueda crecer más en su negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de vestir, para surtir mejor su negocio, Su meta para finales de este año es poder tener la cantidad de 25 personas que la puedan ayudar a vender su mercaderia y poder crecer más en su negocio y poder tener solvencia económica.
texts.en: Sandra Maribel, 31, is a member of the duo “El Retiro” and has two children (her daughter is 3, and her son is 6). She has a stall in Ciudad Vieja where she sells men's, women's, and children's clothing. She also distributes the merchandise to 8 other vendors so that her business can grow faster. She will use the loan to buy clothing to stock her business. Her goal for the end of the year is to have 25 people helping her sell her merchandise so that her business can grow and be financially sound.

loans.use: to buy men's, women's, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Juan Diego

texts.es:
El señor Juan Diego esta casado tiene 32 años de edad, cursó solamente 1 años la educación primaria, se dedica a la tejeduría de cortes típicos, específicamente cortes típicos, inicio este negocio gracias al apoyo de su mamá y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.


Solicita un préstamo que  lo utilizara para la compra de hilos de diferente clases y colores, ya que espera seguir dando los necesarios a su familia, especialmente su esposa e hijos una buenas educación.
texts.en:
Juan Diego is 32 and married. He completed just one year of primary school. He weaves traditional cloth, a profession he began 10 years ago with his mother's support.

He is requesting a loan to buy different types and colors of thread because he wants to continue providing for his family's needs, especially his wife's and children's education.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 32 years old, married to Geoffrey, and blessed with three children aged 16, 14 and 3. She is a tailor, a business she ventured into 14 years ago, and she earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

Mary has requested a second loan of KES 50,000 to purchase bales of flour, washing and bathing soaps, sodas and sugar for a new line of business. 

The profit she earns from this business will help her to pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to be a successful businesswoman and take good care of her children.

loans.use: to purchase bales of flour, washing and bathing soaps, sodas and sugar for a new line of business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grocery items for the grocery-selling business.

loans.name: Wlliam

texts.en:
William lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk-producing area.  He has seven children.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops, transportation services, and a job salary.   He has requested a loan to buy a dairy cow.  He has been doing this work for 20 years. 

William was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan.  He said the product offered -- the dairy cow -- was what he wanted.  William was also asked what he learned during his microfinance training session: "How to manage the loan and farming as a business."

When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?," William replied that from the dairy cow, he will sell milk and thus increase his income; the cow will also give him a calf, thus his assets will increase.

William also stated what is most enjoyable about farming - "being able to get milk and being his own boss!"  His biggest challenge is difficulties in transportation. His highest monthly expense is school fees.  The animals on the farm have been given the names of "Chepsitie, cheborus."

*****For this profile template, Juhudi Kilimo is making microfinance more efficient by gathering information using a mobile device in the field and sending the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper and keeping costs down!*****

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: Nasiba is 22 years old. She is a hardworking woman with a great desire to get ahead. She is not married yet and lives with her parents. With the aim of helping her parents to improve their living conditions, Nasiba began own business six months ago selling women’s clothes. She sells her goods at the local market and has a lot of customers. She is going to widen the assortment of goods she offers and in this way attract more customers. Her parents help her with her business. She is asking for a loan to buy a new variety of women’s clothes in order to widen the assortment she offers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of women’s clothes.

loans.name: Ngempei

texts.en:
Ngempei is 30 years old, married, and blessed with one child who is one year old. He has been in business for three years and earn KES 5,000.

This is Ngempei's first loan from Kiva partner KADET, which he hopes to use to expand his business. He will use the profit he makes to buy a plot. His dream is to have a good business with a good flow of income.

loans.use: to purchase more animals for resale.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
This is Virgilio, 52, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines.  He is working hard to continually provide income for his family's everyday expenses.

Virgilio oversees operations of their Jeepney transportation business.  It has one Jeep that carries up to 16 passengers to their destination within the community.   His income comes from the daily quota the driver remits every day. Their regular passengers and customers are from the local community. He earns a minimum of PHP 800 every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. He will use the loan for the maintenance of his Jeepney vehicle. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Virgilio dreams of having his own house and lot someday. He faithfully meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of their work.  It is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his Jeepney vehicle.

loans.name: Ma. Glenda

texts.en:
Ma. Glenda is 28 years old and married, with three children. She lives in Baliango. 

Ma. Glenda owns and operates a small retail store to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years. She earns PHP 3,500 each month from it. 

She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional products to sell, like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee. 

Ma. Glenda joined GDMPC in 2010. In the future, Ma. Glenda wants to have enough to pay for her children completing their education.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar, and coffee.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 41 years old, is married to John, and has two children. She has been in poultry farming for the last ten years, earning KES 50,000 monthly.

This is Jane's third loan from Kiva partner KADET, after successfully servicing her previous loans. She plans to use this loan of KES 100,000 to purchase chick feed and chicks and to renovate the poultry house.

Jane plans to plow the anticipated profits back into the business. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her poultry business in order to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase chick feed and chicks and to renovate the poultry house.

loans.name: Eduard

texts.es: Cuando Eduard inició su negocio lo hizo poco a poco, comprando paulatinamente cada maquina y accesorio requerido para formar su pequeño taller marroquinero, del cual hoy genera los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, conformado por su esposa y su pequeño hijo en la edad de 4 años.  El a sus 39 años ha logrado sostener su fuente de ingresos y tiene muchos sueños de prosperidad  con su microempresa, porque es la unidad que lo ayuda a generar el bienestar de su familia. Su meta principal es estabilizar completamente su negocio y ubicar un punto comercial al lado de este, pero su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente para hacer varias inversiones al mismo tiempo y por ello ha recurrido a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar materias primas e insumos en mayor volumen y  elaborar nuevos diseños de productos, que impacten a su clientela, con el fin de vender cada vez mas. Con su crédito anterior aumentó su capital de trabajo y así mismo su clientela, por eso está muy entusiasmado y no deja de pensar en su  sueño de prosperidad. Eduard en su negocio vende a almacenes y a particulares, tiene clientes fijos a los cuales les otorga créditos y también le pagan de contado, él está muy pendiente de las exhibiciones, ferias, mercados abiertos que hay en Bogotá para participar y darse a conocer, porque sus expectativas de crecimiento no tienen límites aunque va avanzando gradualmente, pero conpaso firme.
texts.en:
When Eduard started his business, he slowly and carefully bought each machine and part needed to equip his small leather goods shop. Today the business generates income to support his household, which comprises his wife and 4-year-old son. At 39, he has maintained his income source and dreams of prosperity for his micro business, which is the entity that provides for his family's welfare. His main goal is to fully establish his business in a commercial space on the east side, but he lacks sufficient working capital to make several investments at the same time.

Therefore, he is requesting another Kiva loan, which will be his second loan cycle with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy wholesale supplies and create new designs that will impress his customers and increase sales. The previous loan increased his working capital as well as his customer base, so he is very enthusiastic and continues to dream of prosperity. Eduard sells to department stores and individuals; he has loyal customers to whom he extends credit and others that pay cash. He is looking forward to participating and getting recognition at the exhibitions, fairs, and open markets in Bogotá. He believes his potential is unlimited, and though growth may be slow, it will be steady.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies and create new designs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 41-year-old married woman who lives in Bohol, Philippines. She has run a bakery in her place for more than six years now. Her husband works as a baker.  Josephine works hard to earn a living to help meet the needs of the family, especially for the education of their son.

Josephine is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional materials and ingredients for baking, such as flour, sugar, butter, and eggs. With this, they will be able to bake more bread and other snack foods to sell in their bakery, thus attracting more customers and buyers.

Josephine dreams of improving her business, so that it will generate more income necessary for their daily needs. Any additional revenue will be used to reinvest in the same business and for savings.

loans.use: to buy materials and ingredients for baking, such as flour, sugar, butter, and eggs.

loans.name: Edward Saitoti

texts.en: Edward has serviced his third loan, and the business is doing great. He is applying for his fourth loan of KES.50,000 from KADET LTD to pay for farm labour, fertilizers and  seed planting. Edward will use the profits to increase his farm acreage as he works toward bettering his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Waren

texts.en:
Waren is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married, with one child. 

Waren is providing "motorela," or motorcycle, services.   He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to pay for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

Waren is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, he hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Charo

texts.en:
Charo is 44 years old.  He lives in the city of Mombasa in Msambweni District, with his spouse and six beloved children. He’s always been a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who puts all his efforts into moving his family forward.  With much enthusiasm and thanks to support from his family, Charo works day to day in a small phone-charging stall. 

Charo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help he’s received, he will be able to buy a motorcycle to start another business.  

That will increase his income and help insure his children’s education and well-being.  He dreams of them becoming good professionals and upstanding citizens. 

Charo anticipates good income from his motorcycle taxi, since he is always optimistic.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle and start a taxi service.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is Elizabeth, who previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy herbal products to expand the inventory needed in her business. Her earnings have been a big help in the education of her children and in the family's personal, household and business expenditures.

Elizabeth would like to apply for a new loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fabric, thread and other raw materials. Her profits will definitely continue to help her sustain her daily needs and meet the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Elizabeth hopes to be able to expand her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group comprises 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional herbal supplies and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is married, with three children. She is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. Shiela is a farmer and she cultivates fruits such as durian to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years and every month she earn 3,500 PHP from this work. 

She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. Shiela is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, she hopes to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Claudia Milena

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva, Claudia compró una máquina de collarín, puso una puerta al local donde funciona el negocio, con lo que mejjoró la presentación del establecimeinto y aumentó su productividad y calidad en la prenda. Hoy está aplicando a un nuevo creidkiva, porque quiere mejorar completamente la infraestrura de su taller, comprando 3 máquinas mas y materia prima, pues tiene como clientes a boutiques que requieren calidad total en el proceso productivo y precios competitivos. Su mensaje a los finaciadoresde Kiva es el siguiente:   " Agradecimientos a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y a KIVA, por este apoyo económico Dios los bendiga y espero que me sigan apoyando: "
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan Claudia bought an industrial sewing machine.  She also put a door on the place where her business functions.  These things improved her establishment’s appearance and increased her productivity and the quality of the clothes. 

She is now applying for a new Kiva loan.  She wants to completely improve the infrastructure of her workshop by purchasing three more machines and raw materials.  Her customers are boutiques who require overall quality in the productive process and competitive prices.

Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following:  “Thank you, Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and Kiva.  May God bless you for the financial support, and I hope that you continue supporting me.”

loans.use: to buy three more machines and raw material.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  is widowed with five children, and three of her children go to school.  She also takes care of other family members (her grandchildren).  

Sarah sells charcoal, and she has been in this business for two years.  She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of charcoal.  

She works from her home and sells to all categories of people on retail seven days week.  Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease her transportation troubles and to become a wholesaler.  

She resides in her own house.  The family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include paying school fees, paying for electricity, and feeding the family.  Besides her charcoal business, she generates additional income from rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of slippers, cellphone accessories, and snacks

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help with paying for the education of her children and her family's personal, household and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Susan dreams of being able to give all of her children a good and high-quality education through all of her hard work in her business. She also prays that her children who already have their own families will be able to have their own house and lot for their respective families. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship meeting,* where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT community members are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners that meet on a weekly basis. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Kaphilinzi

texts.en:
Kaphilinzi is 40 years old and lives in his own home together with his family, which is composed of his wife and their six children. He is a very hard-working man who is committed to working a lot for his family. He is an honorable and honest man who has always completed his work in the best way.

Kaphilinzi has always worked operating a goat-meat business. Among his large number of his customers, demand for more meat, especially this month of Ramadan, has grown. However, he doesn't have enough capital to satisfy his customers' needs. It was because of this that he reached out to Yehu to seek a loan to see if he could buy more goats for slaughter. 

Kaphilinzi is thankful in advance for the help that he will receive. He is sure that with the profits he will be able to repay the loan on time, and in this way he will continue providing a better life for his family.

loans.use: buy more goats for slaughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more yellow bananas and charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Jhunrey

texts.en:
Jhunrey, 27 years old, is a single entrepreneur from D'ban, Calamba. He is earning from his piggery business. He has been in this business for almost two years now, and he earns PHP 3,000 a month. 

To improve his business, he is borrowing the amount of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC Microcredit, which he just joined recently, to buy feed. 

He is hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business before long.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: María Transíto

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace cinco meses administra su propia tienda, ubicada en un lugar estratégico que con mucho esfuerzo la ha surtido de variedad de productos. Ella ha sido una persona que siempre le ha gustado trabajar, para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Siempre en su casa mantiene de 2 a 3 cerdos y pollos, es una actividad que siempre le ha gustado desempeñar, su mamá ha sido quien le enseño a ganarse la vida honradamente. Ella viaja cada ocho días a realizar sus compras, tarda en autobús unos cuarenta y cinco minutos en llegar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para surtir más la tienda, ya que en vacaciones se vende más y para comprar mercadería para surtir el cafetín que tiene en una escuela. Con el objetivo de obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia y enviar sus hijos a la escuela para que se superen cada día más.
texts.en:
Maria, age 32, is married and has three children.  She has been running her own business for five months.  It is located in a strategic place, which, with great effort, she has stocked with a variety of products.

She is a person who has always liked working in order to help her husband with the household expenses.  At her house she always keeps two or three pigs and chickens.  It is a business activity that she has always liked doing.  Her mother is the one who taught her how to earn a living honorably.  She travels every eight days to make her purchases.  It takes her 45 minutes by bus to get there.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to stock her store because she sells more during vacations.  She will also use the loan to buy merchandise to stock the snack bar that she has at a school.  Her objective for doing this is to get greater income that will allow her family to improve their standard of living.  It is also to send her children to school so that they improve every day.

loans.use: to stock her store and to buy merchandise to stock the snack bar she has at a school.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a single mother of three children, and two of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She has a business of selling second-hand shoes and has been in this business for 20 years.  She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. 

She works at the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked stall of shoes and also to become a wholesaler.  

She resides in her own house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 30-year-old lady from Kisumu.  She is married to Maurice, and they have a 10-month-old child.

Elizabeth operates an M-pesa service business (a mobile money transfer service very popular in Kenya), and she has been doing this for the last four years.  She makes a monthly income of KES 40,000. 

She is taking her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to increase her business float.  She will then use anticipated profits to educate her child. Her dream is to give the best education to her children.

loans.use: To increase the float for her M-pesa service.

loans.name: Angela Del Carmen

texts.es: Angela y su cónyuge viven en la ciudad de Cartagena con sus 3 hijos en las edades de 1 a 4 años; ambos trabajan fuertemente para el sostenimiento de su hogar, en su propio negocio, mediante el cual  preparan y venden productos fritos. Ellos realizan su tarea productiva en su propia casa, y posteriormente se dedican a la venta en un punto comercial,  cerca a su vivienda, en un corredor a orillas de una carretera de tráfico   vehicular  y peatonal,  que potencializa sus ventas. Sus principales productos son los patacones, arepas con huevo, cerdo frito entre otros. Las ventas las realizan de contado y a diario desde las 2 de la tarde hasta las 10 de la noche, su meta es comprar mesas y sillas e implementos de cocina, además de materiales e insumos para el desempeño de su trabajo. Esta es la razón por la cual acuden a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hacen a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues con esta inversión, planean  mejorar su servicio y las condiciones de su oferta de productos y aumentar el volumen de ventas y la generación de mayores ingresos,  para impactar positivamente el bienestar de su familia; Ellos sueñan ver convertidos en adultos exitosos  a sus hijos y por ellos se esmeran diariamente en su trabajo, con el fin de lograrlo. Su meta a mediano plazo es tener una vivienda propia que de estabilidad familiar y logren avanzar en su hogar
texts.en: Angela and her husband live in the city of Cartagena with their three children ages 1-4. They both work hard in their business to support their household. They prepare and sell fried products. They prepare the food at home and subsequently sell it from a separate commercial location near their home, near the edge of a busy road trafficked by vehicles and pedestrians. This boosts their sales. Their main products are patacones, arepas con huevo, and cerdo frito, among others. Their sales are made in cash daily between 2 pm and 10 pm. Their goal is to buy tables, chairs, and kitchen supplies, as well as materials and supplies for their work. This is why they are looking for a Kiva loan. This is their first loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this investment, they plan to improve their service and products, and to increase sales volume. This will increase their income and positively affect their family's well-being. They dream of seeing their children become successful adults; with this in mind, they work very hard every day. Their mid-term goal is to have their own home for the sake of stability.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and kitchen utensils, as well as materials and supplies.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is married, with four children.  He is 43 years old and lives at Bunawan, Calamba. 

Michael raises crops, planting and harvesting bananas and coconuts for sale to earn a living.  He has been five years in this business. Each month, he earns PHP 10,000 from it. 

He requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. 

Michael joined GDMPC this year. In the future, Michael wants to save as a reserve for emergencies and to purchase another farm land.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.en:
Yuldosh is 61 years old. He and his wife are happy; they have three children. He is very hardworking and kind-natured. He has a lot of friends, and all of them love him very much.

Yuldosh has been farming for 30 years, producing crops and vegetables, such as tomatos, potatoes, and watermelon. He has been in this line of work since he was a boy, so all of his experience has been dedicated to producing crops and vegetables. His products are sold at the local market. 

In order to provide his crops and vegetables with the needed attention, Yuldosh is requesting a loan in the amount of TJS 1,500, so he can buy fertilizer and seeds and continue improving his production. 

He hopes to generate more income and take advantage of the high prices, so he can maintain a better standard of living. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Alicia Teresa

texts.es:
Alicia tiene 41 años de edad, vive al lado de su hijo de 14 años de edad, a quien quiere mucho y por quien da la vida con tal de darle una vida digna y sobre todo cariño, Alicia a sacado adelante asola a su hijo ya que su esposo la abandono y se convirtió en madre y padre para él. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear con su hijo y sobre todo le gusta compartir con el uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “aguadito de Pato”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Alicia solo tuvo estudios secundarios pero le hubiera gustado para ser diseñadora de modas.

Día a día Alicia trabaja en su negocio de venta de carne de cerdo, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 cliente diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los cliente y siempre les da el peso exacto por eso los clientes siempre le compran.

Alicia está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una congeladora para poder guardar en mejor condición sus productos y brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes, con lo cual mejorar sus ingresos y de esa manera podrá seguir trabajando y luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Alicia is 41 years old and lives with her 14 year old son who she loves very much and for whom she gives her life in order to give him a dignified and above all caring existence.  Alicia has helped her son move forward on her own since her husband abandoned her and she became mother and father to their child.  When she has free time she likes very much to go walking with her son and above all she likes to share with him one of his favorite dishes which is the tasty "Aguadito de Pato" or Duck Stew.  Due to her limited economic means Alicia only completed Middle School, but she would have liked very much to be a fashion designer.  

Day to day Alicia works in her business selling pork.  She works around 10 hours per day and can serve up to 30 customers daily.  She believes that her business is successful because she is very nice to her customers and she always gives them the exact weight.  For that reason customers always buy from her.  

Alicia is very thankful for the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have given she will be able to buy a freezer in order to keep her products in better condition and to offer better service to her customers.  Thus, she can improve her income and in that way she will be able to continue working and struggling each day in order to make her greatest dream a reality: "To have her own home."

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: Roberto Marcelo

texts.es: El cliente, Roberto, es un señor de 33 años de edad, es soltero, el cliente trabaja en una empresa de distribuidora de bebidas a elección, donde la empresa queda a 10 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, actualmente el cliente vive por la zona oeste de la ciudad de Cochabamba, aproximadamente a 7 1/2 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive el cliente es de sus padres, el cliente vive con sus padres y hermanos, el cliente  no tiene hijos dependientes y el destino del nuevo crédito de la institución es para la compra de mercadería, (bebidas para la venta), ya que el cliente con el negocio nuevo tendrá mas ingresos y de alguna u otra manera podrá satisfacer sus necesidades que tiene en su familia, ya que en este momento su trabajo no le genera un buen ingreso, es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia del cliente, para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.
texts.en:
Roberto is a single gentleman who is 33 years of age. He works at a major beverage distribution company that is located 10 kilometers outside of the city of Cochabamba. Roberto currently lives in an area west of Cochabamba that is 7.5 kilometers away. The house where he lives belongs to his parents and he lives with them and his siblings. He has no dependent children.

This new loan will be used to buy merchandise (beverages to sell). With this new business, Roberto will be able to have more income so that he can meet the needs of his family in one way or another. At the moment, he does not generate good income from his work. For this reason, CIDRE is presenting Roberto’s story so that it can be shared with everyone.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell.

loans.name: Kattia

texts.es: Kattia, tiene la edad  de 24 años, está en unión libre, vive con su hijo y esposo  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de semillas, madera, plástico entre otros materiales y pagar mano de obra para los trabajos realizados, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar  la buena topografía del terreno, clima, agua potable y la experiencia en el cultivo de hortalizas, en el corto o mediano plazo tener una plantación para la venta. Con los posibles ingresos espera ir invirtiendo un poco más además de mejorar su condición de vida y cumplir algunas metas familiares. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Kattia is 24 years old. She is in a common-law marriage, and lives with her son and husband, who are her greatest priorities. With her loan, she intends to purchase seeds, wood, and plastic, among other materials, and to pay labor for the work done. In this way she will ensure a job well done. She intends to take advantage of the good topography of the terrain, climate, potable water and experience in vegetable farming, and in the short or medium term, to have a plantation for sale. With the possible profits she expects to invest a little more, in addition to improving her condition of life and to fulfill some family goals. 

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She hasn't had other loans from government banks before, but FUDECOSUR has offered her the loan with greater ease and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant vegetables.

loans.name: Rufilia

texts.es: Rufilia es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy II, tiene 41 años de edad, es casada y madre de 5 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de cochinilla y tara. Ella dice que le gustan las capacitaciones que recibe en su Banco Comunal porque aprende valores, también le gustan las ferias de salud que brinda FINCA Perú porque de esa manera incentivan a las socias a que cuiden su salud sobre todo para las personas que no tienen mucho recursos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de cochinilla y tara.
texts.en: Rufilia is a member of Tarpuy II Communal Bank. She is 41 years old, married and the mother of 5 children. She sells cochineal and tara . She says she enjoys the training workshops she receives in her communal bank because she learns values and she also enjoys the health fairs that FINCA Perú offers because in that way members are encouraged to take care of their health, above all those who do not have many resources. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of cochineal and tara.

loans.use: to purchase cochineal and tara.

loans.name: Kambarage Group

texts.en:
Zakayo, who is in his late 20s, is married with three children who go to school. He has been selling charcoal for five years now. He is really working hard; he works from 6.00 a.m. to 6.00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy more sacks of charcoal and pay household expenses and school fees. He has paid back all his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.  

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Kambarage," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Khy

texts.en:
Khy is a 53-year-old single parent of a grown-up child. Her son is already married and lives together with her in an old house in Kompong Cham province. Khy plants and harvests rice and lotus fruits to sell, with a harvest which occurs twice a year. Khy’s son and her daughter-in-law help her in the business to ensure a high production each harvest season. 

Khy has been a farmer for over 30 years, earning approximately 6,000 KHR per day. Khy would like to further improve her farming practices and yield a better income during the year. This leads Khy to return to HKL for her sixth cycle loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and to pay labor costs for working on her dry-season rice fields. She hopes for a fruitful harvest in this coming season.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and to pay labor costs for working on her dry-season rice fields.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en: Luzviminda of Macabibo, Sapang Dalaga supports her four kids through her "nipa" panel making business. She’s 52 years old and married, and tries her best to earn on her own. For three years, she has managed this business and earns about 3,500 PHP per month. Right now, she needs to buy more "nipa" to be used in  her business. She joined just this year and thanks GDMPC micro finance for the loan of 4,000 PHP they are providing to her. Luzviminda desires to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more 'nipa' to be used in  her business

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 39-year-old married man. He has two children, 10 years and to 15 years old. He describes himself to be a humble and faithful man. He operates a retail store where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located within a busy market  and his primary customers are local residents. 

David describes his biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. He will use the Kes 8,700 loan to buy a water tank. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved his business. David received a loan of Kes 20,000 which he managed to repay.He is also involved in activities such as farming, motorbike transportation services, etc.

loans.use: to buy a water tank worth Kes 8,700

loans.name: Duo Jeshúa Group

texts.es:
DUO JESHUA
Es integrada por la señora Romelia de 56 año  y su hija Catalina de 33 años de edad, doña Romelia quien se dedica desde hace 8 años a la elaboración y venta de tortillas en su domicilio, doña Romelia vende en los dos tiempos de comida, todos los días, doña Romelia enviudo hace 25 años quedándose así a cargo de sus 5 hijos, quienes hoy en día le brindan ayuda y su agradecimiento por la lucha constante que ella realizo por ellos, es así como doña Romelia a trabajando en diferentes actividades pero hoy en día mucha gente la visita en su domicilio para comprar sus tortillas recién salidas del comal,está solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz y leña para la elavoración de tortillas.
texts.en:
DUO JESHUA is made up of Romelia, who is fifty-six years old, and her daughter Catalina, who is thirty-three. For the past eight years, Romelia has made a living making and selling tortillas in her home. Romelia sells at both meal times every day. She was widowed twenty-five years ago, leaving the care of her five children entirely to her. Today, they help her and are grateful for the constant struggle that she went through for them. 

In this way, Romelia has been working a variety of jobs, but today many people visit her in her home to buy tortillas hot off the comal (hot plate for making tortillas). She is requesting this loan in order to purchase corn and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en: Prossy's group is comprised of four hardworking women. Prossy is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kalisizo in the Masaka region of Uganda. She is single and has two children; one of them is currently in school. Prossy has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fresh food like matooke (green plantains). To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food like matooke for resale, and will help Prossy to generate greater profits and take care of her children. Prossy hopes that, in the future, she will be able to get more capital and open up a retail shop. Prossy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food like matooke (green plantains) for resale.

loans.name: Gomersenda

texts.en:
