Mirian is 27 years old and lives in a small village in the Keda district. He is married and has two children, aged four and six. Mirian’s wife Melano is a homemaker and tries to do the best for the family. Mirian has a bakery where he bakes a variety of cookies. He has a rich experience in this business. Besides this work, he is involved in sowing crops. He has a large plot of land by his house, where he grows vegetables and fruit. The family has a vineyard as well. Mirian picks grapes in late summer and produces wine. He sells all his products at the local open market. He is a hardworking man who is responsible and very well known in the area for his big heart and friendliness toward others. 

Mirian requested a loan to purchase raw materials for his bakery and to increase sales. He wants to expand his business. The amount of products he sells is not enough to cover the high demand. 

With this loan, Mirian will also be able to purchase herbicide and insecticide for his vineyard. These materials will allow Mirian to prevent pests and pick more grapes. With great trust in his work, Mirian hopes to have an abundant harvest that he can sell, earning income to cover household necessities so that he can realize his dream of giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase herbicide and insecticide for his vineyard

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is 46 years old. She lives in the Tskaltubo District with her husband Badri and their two sons (17 and 22 years old).  The younger son attends the village school and the elder works in construction.  Rusudan and Badri run a small-scale agricultural business, which, along with the elder son’s salary, is the family’s source of income.  They earn an average total of 400 Laris a month. It is not enough for a four-member family to sustain normal living conditions. According to Credo’s estimate, the family falls into the “vulnerable poor” category. 
	
Rusudan and Badri have 2 milking cows, and also produce cheese. Part of the cheese is consumed by the family and the rest is sold in the village. Rusudan has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to start another agricultural business, but without any success.  Her loan requests were always rejected because of her family’s low income and poor living conditions. 

Rusudan then requested a loan from Credo to start a new business. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides credit to the rural poor who do not have access to it, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the loan Rusudan will purchase a tractor to provide seasonal agricultural services to local farmers, for which she will charge a service fee.  This new business initiative will double the family’s income and enable them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is the single mother of six children, who go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family. She has a business selling used clothes and has been in this business for nine years. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income through poultry farming. She sells door to door. Her major business challenges include transportation and the rainy season which hinders her movements. 

She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to get a permanent business premise. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothing

loans.name: Jumanne

texts.en:
Jumanne is 38 years old and lives with his life companion and their four children. He operates a grocery store which has been running for the last ten months. He has fixed customers since people prefer him for the excellent quality and low prices of his products. He is also known for his helpful service.

Jumanne is a man who is dedicated to his work and who is enthusiastic and eager to get ahead. He is always looking for new opportunities that will lead to a prosperous future for him and his family.

During this festive season of Ramadan, he wants to increase his inventory. Consequently he is requesting a loan from Yehu that will enable him to buy groceries such as green peas, onions, potatoes, oranges, and the like. Jumanne is sure he will be able to pay off the debt and at the same time give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as green peas, onions, potatoes, oranges, and the like

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and all her children go to school. She also takes care of two additional family members (her old parents). 

She sells second-hand children's clothes at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the past four years. She works seven days a week.

She has requested a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand children’s clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations are to start importing used children’s clothes and building rental houses. 

She lives in her own house, and the family has access to electricity but has no access to piped water. Her major expenses include paying for electricity and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes for children.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is 26 years old and lives together with his life partner and their three children. He is a hard-working person who has been working as a mason for several years. 

Six months ago, he decided to start a grocery store, which he manages together with his wife. Hamisi is a kind person who is easy to befriend, which is why he has already made a couple of customers.

Hamisi is requesting a loan from Yehu to buy fruits and vegetables. He would like to carry out this work together with his wife so that they can improve the family's quality of life. He says that this will give him a more comfortable home for his young children. Hamisi's wish is to provide his children with an education and to set up a small business selling basic household products such as beans, rice, etc.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Mireille Colliane

texts.fr: Mireille est une jeune femme de 27 ans, célibataire, mère de 02 enfants dont l'age varie entre 1 et 6 ans, l'un de ses enfants va déjà à l'école. Elle a un pressing qu'elle gère depuis 2 ans déjà. Son savoir faire, son éfficacité, sa ponctualité lui permis d'agrandir une clientèle au fil du temps .elle a une bonne clientèle mais se retrouve tout le temps en rupture de matériel de travail pour cause elle l'achète en détail et cela lui cause souvant des préjudices. Ce crédit lui permettra d'acheter les matérières 1ères en gros (détergents, javel, emballages...) ce qui permettrea d'atteindre ses objectifs, satisfaire sa clientèle et réaliser un bon profit. Ce bénéfice lui permettra non seulement de subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens et ceux de sa famille, mais aussi d'agrandir son activité avec le temps en achetant en grande quantité.
texts.en:
Mireille is a 27-year-old young woman. She is single and has two children aged one and six; one of the children already goes to school. She owns a laundry service which she has been managing for two years already. Her know-how, efficiency, and punctuality have allowed her to grow her business as time went.
She has a good customer base, but continually experiences shortages of work supplies since she purchases it retail and it often disadvantages her. This loan will allow her to purchase her supplies (such as detergents, bleach, wrappers…) wholesale, which will in turn enable her to reach her objectives to satisfy her customers and to make a good profit. This profit will allow her not only to provide for her daily needs as well as her family’s, but also to grow her business over time by purchasing in bulk.

loans.use: to buy wholesale supplies (detergents, bleach, wrappers...)

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past year, Joyce has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells car spare parts. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more auto parts for her business and will help Joyce to generate greater profits; with those profits she plans to buy rental houses. Joyce hopes that, in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more auto parts for her business.

loans.name: Kpenangni Clémentine

texts.fr: Agée de 31 ans, Kpenangni Clémentine vit chez son mari et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 09 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. Elle a une boutique où elle vend des biscuites et des bonbons depuis des années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et de renforcer son activité, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit auprès de finadev en vue de satisfaire la demande de ses clients et d'accroître son revenu supplémentaire. Le gain supplémentaire lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'aider son mari à achever la construction de leur maison qui est en chantier.
texts.en:
At age 31, Kpenangni Clémentine lives with her husband and is the mother of three children, two of whom go to school. The oldest is nine years old and the youngest is two.
For years, she has owned a shop in which she sells cookies and candy. She gets her supplies from one of Benin’s markets. Desirous to increase her sales and to strengthen her business, she requested and obtained a micro-loan from finadev, with the objective to meet consumer demand and to increase her supplemental revenues.
The additional profit will allow her to participate to paying her children’s school expenses and to help her husband finish building their house, which is currently under construction.

loans.use: to buy 10 boxes of cookies and 20 boxes of candy.

loans.name: Amévi

texts.fr: Amevi a 35 ans, il vit à Lomé avec sa femme et ses enfants qui ont entre 3 et 15 ans. Les deux plus âgés sont scolarisés. L'épouse d’Amevi est revendeuse. Amevi est lui aussi revendeur. Depuis 9 ans il achète et revend des pièces détachées d'auto en particulier des batteries. Il emploie à ce jour deux personnes dans sa boutique. Amevi sollicite un crédit auprès de Wages dans le but d'augmenter son stock en pièces détachées. Il a pour projet d'utiliser les bénéfices qu'il fera pour la construction d'une troisième boutique. Il espère que les revenus de son activité permettront d'assurer la scolarité de ses trois enfants.
texts.en:
Amevi is 35 years old; he lives in Lome with his wife and children, who are between three and fifteen years of age. The two oldest children go to school. Amevi’s wife works in retail.
Amevi also is in retail: for nine years, he has been purchasing and reselling auto parts, notably batteries. These days, he employs two persons in his store.
Amevi is requesting a loan from Wages to increase his stock of spare parts. His plan is to use the profit to build a third store. He is hoping that revenues from his business will allow him to send his children to school.

loans.use: to buy batteries and spare parts.

loans.name: Kintossou Saturnine

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux fréquentent encore, Kintossou Saturnine vend des sous vêtements, des habits et des chaussures depuis plusieurs années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de combler les besoins de ses clients, Kintossou Saturnine a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un appui financier à Finadev afin de maximiser son intérêt et de contribuer à la formation professionnelle de ses enfants. Elle envisage de fournir des soins médicaux adéquats à ses enfants et d'élargir son activité afin de devenir une grossiste.
texts.en:
Married and a mother of three children, two of whom still go to school, Kintossou Saturnine has been selling underwear, clothing, and shoes for a few years. She gets her supplies from one of Benin’s markets.
To increase her purchasing power and meet consumer needs, Kintossou Saturnine requested and obtained financial support from Finadev. Her goal is to maximize profits and to contribute to her children’s professional training. She is planning on providing adequate healthcare to her children and wants to grow her business to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy one lot of underwear and twenty pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. Juan  tiene 29 años y es casado con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de cinco años, el se dedica a la venta  de madera desde hace ya siete años esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre quien también se dedica a la venta e madera su puesto de acopio se encuentra ubicado en la localidad de Puerto Rico, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Juan utilizara  este préstamo  para  la compra de motosierras para costar la madera, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de estas herramientas de trabajo, ya que esto no le permite cortar en mayor cantidad, El Sr. Juan  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, su deseo es ser uno de los mejores vendedores de madera y así de esta manera mejorar la venta y por ende sus ganancias, ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, por este motivo se siente feliz ya agradecido a la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Juan, 29, is married and has a five-year-old son.  He’s been selling lumber for the last seven years, an activity he learned from his father who also sells lumber.  His distribution point is located in the town of Puerto Rico.  This loan is his first sequence in the institution and Juan will use it to buy power saws to cut wood.  His reason for requesting the loan is the lack of capital needed to buy work tools which keeps him from being able to cut large amounts.  Juan’s business challenge is to rise out of poverty.  He will use profits to improve his and his family’s quality of life.  His wish is to become one of the best lumber sellers to improve sales and thus profits because this is the only activity that allows him to support himself and his family.  Because of this he feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy power saws.

loans.name: Khatia

texts.en:
Khatia is 21 years old and lives in a small village in the Khelvachauri district. She lives with her parents, grandparents and siblings. Her father Bondo is a taxi driver who serves local people with his own car. He is very sociable and that’s why he attracts a lot of clients. Her mother Naira does the housework and tries to do her best for the family. Khatia’s grandparents have a retirement pension. Her siblings are students. 
	
Khatia is a state employee and gets a monthly salary. Besides this work, she is involved in sowing agricultural crops. She has a large plot of land by the house, where she grows citrus, fruit, and vegetables. She sells a variety of vegetables and fruit at the local open market. She is a hard working person who is responsible and very well known in the area for her big heart and friendliness toward others.

Khatia is asking for a loan to buy herbicide and insecticide to apply to her citrus garden. These materials will allow her to give it active care to prevent pests, to improve her crop production, and expand the agricultural business. Khatia and her family wish to increase their business further by selling more citrus and other agricultural products. With this loan Khatia will be able to raise the level of family’s living conditions and save some money for her University tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase herbicide and insecticide for her citrus garden

loans.name: Koffigan

texts.fr: Koffigan habite à Lomé avec sa femme et ses 5 enfants âgés de 1 à 11 ans. Les quatre ainés sont scolarisés. La femme de Koffigan est couturière. Il exerce, pour sa part, depuis 5 ans, la profession de déclarant en douane. Il s'occupe de la sortie des marchandises et en parallèle vend des pneus. C'est dans le but de développer cette seconde activité qu'il sollicite un crédit chez Wages. Il aimerait augmenter son stock. Il espère à l'avenir devenir un vendeur influent de la place. Sur le plan familial, il désire mettre sa famille à l'écart du besoin.
texts.en:
Koffigan libes in Lomé with his wife and his five children aged one to eleven. The oldest four go to school. Koffigan’s wife is a seamstress.
For his part, he is a custom declaration manager. He handles merchandise exports, and in parallel retails tires. To develop this second business, he is requesting a loan from Wages. He would like to increase his stocks. In the future, he hopes to become an influential seller on the local market. On the family side, he would like to see his family free from want.

loans.use: to purchase tires.

loans.name: Exauce De Dieu Group

texts.fr: EXAUCE DE DIEU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Roukouyatou (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 25 ans et est mariée à un certain Ignace. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Roukouyatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de neuf ans, Roukouyatou vend divers produits vivriers (riz, conserves et condiments) dans un quartier du Bénin. Parallèlement à cette activité, Roukouyatou vend des mèches. Roukouyatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Roukouyatou et les autres membres du groupe EXAUCE DE DIEU sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
"EXAUCE DE DIEU " is a group composed of three persons who reside in the same district. The group's representative, Roukouyatou (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 25 years old and married to a man named Ignace. The couple have three children, all in school and in their care. Roukouyatou lives together with her children and husband, and along with her husband, she ensures that the different household expenses are covered.

For nearly nine years, Roukouyatou has been selling a variety of staple foods (rice, canned goods, and condiments) in a district in Benin. Parallel to this business, she sells hair extensions. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

This is the third time that Roukouyatou and the other members of the group "EXAUCE DE DIEU" have requested financial support from ALIDé with the aim of responding better to the requirements of their customers. The loans previously received were indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy various staple foods (rice, canned goods, and condiments)

loans.name: Julienne Cimolice

texts.fr: Juiliene est une femme agée de 41 ans, célibataire, mère de 6 ans dont l'age varie entre 6 et 18 ans, et tous vont déjà à l'école. Elle a un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis 5 ans déjà. C'est grace à cette activté qu'elle nourrit sa famille. Elle achète le plus souvant les aliments de son restaurant en détail(riz, huile poisson, viande, arachides et boissons), elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter le stock de ces aliments (en gros)ce qui lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante, mais aussi de réaliser un bénéfice plus élévé qui l'aidera à subvenir à certains besoins quotidiens de sa grande famille et aussi d'agrandir son restaurant avec le temps.
texts.en: Juiliene is a 41-year-old woman, unmarried, and the mother of six children, from 6 to 18 years old. All of the children are in school already. Juiliene has been running a restaurant for five years now. Thanks to this business, she is feeding her family. She purchases the food (rice, oil, fish, meat, peanuts, and beverages) for her restaurant most often at the retail level. She is requesting this loan to increase her stock of food (wholesale). And this will enable her not only to satisfy her growing customer base but also to make higher profits, which will help her to meet certain day-to-day needs of her large family and also to expand her restaurant over time.

loans.use: m purchase rice salt, spaghetti, and sundry basics for making meals

loans.name: Marwan

texts.en:
Marwan is a 27-year-old man who lives in Ibb, Yemen. He has a university degree but he could not get a job so he opened a grocery store which he started with limited capital and income. He is requesting his second loan. Because he is alone and has no one to support him, he has done his best to improve and expand his business with his first loan.  Marwan is planning to get married. 

Marwan is requesting a 200,000 YER youth loan from the Kiva partner AMB to purchase goods such as biscuits, cakes, soft drinks, rice, and canned foods. He hopes that his loan will enable him to continue running his business successfully and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Ayidote Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AYIDOTE est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans un même quartier. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Juliette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Juliette est âgée de 30 ans et est mariée à un certain Ferdinand. Juliette a peu fréquenté l’école et s’est arrêté au niveau primaire. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Juliette vit seule avec ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins du ménage. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Juliette vend depuis neuf ans des tissus et du mil de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Juliette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin et dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Juliette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AYIDOTE, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The group AYIDOTE comprises three persons who reside in the same district. This is the fourth time this group has requested financial aid from ALIDé to boost business. The group's representative, Juliette, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 30 years old and married to a man named Ferdinand. Juliette has had little schooling and dropped out of elementary school. The couple have two children, all in school and in their care. Juliette lives alone with her children. The couple share in meeting the diverse household needs. 

To help with different family needs, Juliette has been selling cloth and millet door to door for nine years. This work enables her to meet her needs without much problem. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin and from a region in Benin.

Seeking to satisfy her customers and to increase her sales and revenues, Juliette, along with the other members of the group AYIDOTE, is requesting a fourth loan from ALIDé. The previous loans were indeed paid back.

loans.use: to buy cloth to sell door to door

loans.name: Nathali Atenas

texts.es:
Nathali es una mujer de 26 años, es soltera, vive con sus padres y hermanos en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y  al apoyo de sus padres ella pudo culminar sus estudios de Obstetricia, ahora se encuentra cursando su cerum para poder conseguir su grado de Obstetra, en sus ratos libres le gusta compartir gratos momentos con su familia y en algunas ocasiones cocina un delicioso Arroz con Pato para engreírlos.
Con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Nathali día a día trabaja en su pequeño negocio de animación de fiestas infantiles y alquiler de luces y equipos de sonido, en el transcurso de la semana ella puede animar un promedio de 3 fiestas para pequeños, dedicando un aproximado de 8 horas diarias a su labor, Nathali se siente a gusto realizando su labor ya que le agradan mucho los niños y le gusta hacerlos feliz.
Nathali se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de un juego de luces, telas, muñecos y entre otros artículos pequeños como gorros, pitos, sonajas, etc.; de esta manera Nathali contará con los implementos necesarios para seguir con su labor, así ella espera poder seguir trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una gran profesional y en una mujer de bien, para así poder ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nathali is a twenty-six year old woman. She is single and lives with her parents and siblings in the city of Ica, which is in the Parcona district. She is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, and she has a great desire to improve her life. Thanks to her efforts and her parents’ support, she was able to finish her studies in Obstetrics. Now, she is registering with the SERUMS program [Rural and Urban Marginal Health Service] to be able to earn her Obstetrics degree. In her free time she likes to share pleasant moments with her family. Sometimes,  she cooks up a delicious dish of rice with duck to pamper them.
On a daily basis, Nathali works at her small business as a children’s party entertainer with lots of determination and enthusiasm. She also rents lighting and sound equipment. Over the course of the week, she entertains an average of three children’s parties, spending approximately eight hours a day working. Nathali is happy working this way since she enjoys children a lot and likes to make them happy.
Nathali is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they offer she will be able to purchase a set of lights, cloth, and dolls, as well as hats, whistles, and rattles, among other small items. This way, Nathali will have the necessary supplies to continue with her work. As a result, she hopes to be able to continue working and striving to achieve her dream of becoming a professional and a woman who is able to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to purchse supplies to entertain at children's parties.

loans.name: Lida

texts.en:
Lida is 51 years old. She lives in the Akhmeta District with her husband Shota and their 26 year old son, their daughter-in-law, and their grandchild. Her husband is unemployed; her son works in construction and her daughter-in-law works as a hospital nurse.  Their salaries are the family’s only source of income, which averages 135 Laris a month. It is hardly enough to provide food for a five-member family. According to Credo’s estimate the family falls into the “subsistence poor” category. 

Lida has requested loans from local financial institutions several times to start an agricultural business, but without any success.  Her loan requests were always rejected because of her family’s low income and poor living conditions. Lida then requested a loan from Credo to re-start a retail business which had been recently suspended due to financial problems. Her loan request was approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program provides credit to the rural poor who do not have access to it, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the loan Lida will purchase stock for the store.  The store building is located in the village and it is closed now.  Selling grocery products will positively impact the family.  This new business initiative will double the their income and enable them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is married with five children, four of whom go to school. She lives in Kampala, Uganda and also has grandchildren. For the past ten years, Teopista has sold cassava chips and chapatti. She also gets additional income from tailoring. Teopista works seven days a week and her major business challenges are seasonality and the increasing prices of cooking oil and transportation. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to running water. Teopista's major expenses include rent, electricity, and school fees. 

Teopista is requesting a 200,000 UGX loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy cooking oil, flour, and materials for making clothes. Her goals and aspirations are to have a shop for her business and to educate her children through university.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour, and materials to make clothes

loans.name: Heang's Group

texts.en:
Heang is 58 year-old widowed mother of seven children. She lives in a thatched roof house in a village of the Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district of Cambodia. To support her family, Heang has been involved in rice farming for 30 years. Her main business challenge is flooding and a lack water which results in low crop yields. Heang is a member of a loan group and she has been with VisionFund for two cycles while the other members have been with VisionFund from between one and three cycles. She has completely repaid her previous loans which have helped relive family’s financial burden. 

Heang is the group leader of this three-member group. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and buy pesticides to protect her crop yields. Heang hopes her loan will enable her to increase income from her current business to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela tiene 34 años, su pareja es Oscar, de 40 años, con quien tiene tres hijos. Juntos viven en la casa que compraron hace 15 años aproximadamente.
Ella se dedica a la venta de agroquímicos (abono, fertilizantes, mochilas fumigadoras, entre otros). Tiene un local que acondicionó en el primer piso de su vivienda hace más de 3 años, y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se encarga de la parte del trabajo pesado. Para Adela este trabajo le es muy rentable, ya que siempre tiene ingresos por parte de los agricultores que siempre adquieren sus productos para mejorar sus parcelas. 
También es consciente de que a veces tiene problemas porque se le agotan los sacos de abono u otro fertilizante, de los más requeridos, ahí es cuando recurre a los préstamos.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, se siente muy contenta de poder contar con este respaldo financiero, y una vez más, se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos, ya que seguirá siendo socia de su banco comunal porque le agradan las reuniones que tienen.
Con estos 4,000 nuevos soles comprará más sacos de abono y frascos de fertilizantes para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Adela is 34 years old. Her partner is Oscar, 40, and they have three children. They live together in the house they bought approximately 15 years ago. She sells agricultural supplies such as manure, fertilizers, sprayer backpacks, and other products. 

She has had a shop set up in the first floor of her home for more than three years. She has the support of her husband, who takes care of the heavy part of the work. 

For Adela, this work is very profitable, as she always has income from the farmers who acquire their products to improve their plots of land. 

She is also aware that at times she has problems, because she runs out of the sacks of manure, or another of the most needed fertilizers. That is when she turns to the loans. 

This is her third loan with MFP. She feels very happy to be able to count on this financial support and once again, she promises to to be on time with her payments. She will continue being a member of her communal bank, because she enjoys the meetings they have.  

With these 4,000 nuevos soles she will buy more bags of manure and containers of fertilizer for stocking her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of manure and containers of fertilizer for stocking her business.

loans.name: Molly

texts.en:
Molly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children, all of whom go to school. Molly has no additional family members. For the past ten years, she has been selling green bananas at the market. Molly works seven days a week and her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have running water. Molly's major expenses include rent and school fees. 

Molly is requesting a 200,000 UGX loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to educate her children through the university level.

loans.use: to buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and all her children go to school. She has no additional family member. She sells fruits and vegetables at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 15 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy baskets of fruits and vegetables like mangoes, oranges, cabbages, tomatoes and onions. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land growing some of these vegetables and fruits and also to educate her children up to university level. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.  Her major expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fruits and vegetables like oranges, mangoes, cabbages, tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
Florence's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Florence is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala East region of Uganda. For the past three years, Florence has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she cooks bananas (matoke) and sells water and soda. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar to cook with and more soda, and will help Florence to generate greater profits. She wants to expand her inventory by carrying other vegetables. Florence hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a big house. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy sugar to cook with and more soda.

loans.name: Minor

texts.es:
Minor es un hombre de 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con su pareja y sus 2 hijos a quienes ama y son su razón principal en la vida, él una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Mecánica que tanto deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta cultivar su huerta y en algunas ocasiones cocina una deliciosa Sarapatera para compartir con su familia.
Gracias al apoyo de su Padre, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, Minor puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de reparación y mantenimiento de vehículos y maquinaria pesada, él cuenta con un taller donde brinda sus servicios, todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana inicia su labor, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Minor se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá culminar la construcción de su vivienda, él realizará el cercado de la parte trasera de su casa y podrá poner piso de concreto a toda su vivienda; de esta manera Minor tendrá su vivienda en condiciones adecuadas para poder brindar mayor bienestar y seguridad a su familia, así el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para que junto a su familia puedan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Minor is a 45 year old man. He lives in the city of Pucallpa with his wife and their two children, whom he loves and who are his main reason for living. He is a very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic person. Together with his wife, he puts all his effort into helping his family get ahead. Unfortunately, due to the need to work and provide for their living expenses, he was not able to study Mechanical Engineering, as he had hoped to do, and would have enjoyed very much if he had been able to do it. In his free time, he likes to work in his garden. Sometimes, he cooks up a delicious pot of turtle soup to share with his family.
Thanks to his father’s help, and with lots of determination and enthusiasm, Minor started his small business repairing and maintaining vehicles and heavy machinery. He has a workshop where he offers his services. He starts working early in the morning every day, and works approximately twelve hours a day. He believes that his business is going well because of his dedication and the friendly treatment he provides his customers.
Minor is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help they have provided him, he will be able to finish building his home. He will build a wall in the back part of his house, and will be able to lay a concrete floor throughout his home. In this way, Minor will have his home better equipped to be able to provide more well-being and safety to his family. As a result, he will continue working and striving so that he and his family will be able to get ahead.

loans.use: to finish building his home.

loans.name: Bihija

texts.en:
Bihija is 30 years old and is married with four children, all of whom are currently inschool. She lives in the town of Kwale, Kenya. For the past two years, Bihija has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells good for the home. 

Bihija is requesting a 40,000 KES loan from Yehu to buy inventory such as cooking oil, flour, and soap to sell. Her loan will help expand her business and generate greater profits that she will use to pay school fees and help improve the quality life for her family. Bihija hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, sugar, flour, and soap to sell

loans.name: Salome's Group

texts.en:
Salome's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Salome is 19 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 2 years, Salome has been working hard to manage her small business where she sells bananas, cassava, sweet potatoes and charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Salome has requested a loan of 800000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to build a container to hold charcoal, and will help Salome to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Salome hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop with a lot of inventory of goods like sugar and salt. 

Salome is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to build a container to hold charcoal

loans.name: José Gilberto

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 66 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Es un hombre con muchas energías y ganas de trabajar. Lleva 50 años dedicándose al cuido y engorde de novillos, oficio que aprendió de su papá. Cada mañana don José se levanta a ordeñar sus tres vacas, luego las lleva al terreno, por la tarde las trae de regreso a su casa. 
Los animales los compra en el tiangue, para llegar ahí aborda un camión que tarda treinta minutos de ida y otros treinta minutos de regreso.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cuatro novillos de repasto, vitaminas y desparacitantes. Con la inversión dispondrá de mayor número de animales y los podrá vender más seguido, con el objetivo de obtener más ingresos que le permitan alimentar a su familia. Su sueño es comprar vacas lecheras de la mejor raza; para asegurar la subsistencia de su familia.
texts.en:
José is 86 years old. He is married and has three children. He is a man with a great deal of energy and desire to work. 

He has been fattening and looking after young bulls for 50 years, an occupation he learned from his father. Each morning, José gets up to milk his three cows, then leads them to the fields. In the afternoon, he brings them back to his house. 

He buys the animals at the street market. In order to get there, he gets on a truck that takes 30 minutes going, and another 30 minutes coming back. 

The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy four young grazing bulls, vitamins and anti-parasite medications. With the investment, he will have a greater number of animals at his disposal, and will be able to sell them more often, with the aim of obtaining more income that will allow him to feed his family. 

His dream is to buy milk cows of the best breed, so that that he can ensure his family's subsistence.

loans.use: To buy four young grazing bulls, vitamins and anti-parasite medications.

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en:
Jackie is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 3 years, Jackie has been working hard to manage her shop where she sells second-hand clothes for men. 

To help expand her business, Jackie has requested a loan of 800000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a wide variety of clothes to sell, and will help Jackie to generate greater profits and build a house. Jackie hopes that in the future she will be able to look after her children well. 

Jackie is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothes to sell

loans.name: Om-Muath Group

texts.en: This group is called Om-Muath, and it consists of 4 members who live in Aden, Yemen. Tahany is 25 years old and married with one child. She lives in Aden, Yemen. She has a stall in the market where she sells clothing. She enjoys her business and has learned to save. She is satisfied with everything she has achieved. Now, she has set a lot of goals, and she is sure that she will reach them. With the youth loan that she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of women's clothing, such as blouses, pants, skirts, polo shirts, and jackets.

loans.use: To buy women's clothing, such as blouses, pants, skirts, polo shirts, and jackets for her business

loans.name: Wilfredo Valerio

texts.es: El Sr. Wilfredo, tiene 45 años, con buena referencia crediticia, se dedica a la elaboración de bolsitas de polietileno para el envasado de  líquidos de toda medida a petición de los clientes. El sr Wilfredo es un cliente muy trabajador con mucha experiencia, hace 20 años que inicio su actividad y oficio, con la elaboración de bolsas de polietileno, razón por la cual llegó a equipar su taller con todos los equipos necesarios como: extrusora, selladoras de todas medidas, todo esto con la ayuda de su familia, que siempre está a su lado, el Sr. Wilfredo, vive en  la zona Achachicala, desde hace mucho tiempo es bueno también señalar que don Wilfredo una vez que termine este de pagar este crédito espera sacar montos más altos, con el dinero del crédito comprara materia prima para la fabricación de las bolsas como polipropileno de toda medida, el Sr. Wilfredo es una persona muy emprendedora con el tiempo desea poder vender sus productos a los distintos  supermercados de la ciudad de la Paz y de toda Bolivia, se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan con la otorgación del crédito que le permite mejorar en su actividad.
texts.en: Wilfredo is 45 years old, with a good credit history. He makes polyethylene bags which, depending on his customers' orders, are used to hold various amounts of liquids. Wilfredo is a hard-working man who has lots of experience. He started his business twenty years ago. In order to produce polyethylene bags he had to furnish his workshop with all the necessary equipment, such as an extruder and sealers of all sizes. Wilfredo has done this with the help of his family, who is always by his side. Wilfredo has lived in the Achachicala district for a long time. It is worth noting that once Don Wilfredo finishes repaying this loan he hopes to take out larger loans. With the loan money he will purchase raw materials to make bags, such as polypropylene. Wilfredo is a very enterprising person, who, in time, hopes to be able to sell his products to the different supermarkets in the city of La Paz and throughout Bolivia. He is very grateful for the opportunity he has been offered as a result of receiving this loan, which will help him to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase polypropylene bags of various sizes.

loans.name: Con Suerte Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CON SUERTE” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamata, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosmery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: compra venta de papa y de chuño, venta de cerveza y refresco, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, transportista, tapicería, compra y venta de oveja.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosmery es una integrante, ella indica que desde hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a su casa a visitarla. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; cuenta con el préstamo obtenido en el primer ciclo inicio su negocio por iniciativa propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para incremento ampliación de negocio (compra de fideo, arroz, aceite, etc.) mismo que comprará de los almacenes distribuidores, posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias de su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud.
texts.en:
The communal association "Con Suerte" ("With Luck") will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Patacamata. It is made up of eleven members and led by a board of directors, of which Rosmery is the president. Members of the association maintain a variety of different businesses. Among them we have: buying and selling potatoes and potato flour, selling beer and sodas, selling food, a neighborhood store, transportation, upholstery, and buying and selling sheep.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microbusinesses, including Rosmery's. She indicates that she has been a member of  Pro Mujer for the past three years, joining by invitation from a promoter of the institution who came to visit her home. She currently has a food sales business. The loan she received in her first loan cycle helped her start her business by her own initiative.
 
The loan that she will take out now is to continue expanding her business. She will use it to buy noodles, rice, oil, etc., which she will purchase from wholesale distributors. After preparing the food, she will sell it at markets in her community. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family—as much as she can—since she is single and has one son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Rosmery responded that she likes the health training.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Terezinha

texts.en: Terezinha is 26 years old. She is married. She has 3 children, and her husband is a driver. She has a kiosk in front of her home to supply people in her village with basic goods. She will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan, including noodles, soft drinks, alcoholic drinks, and rice. She has been doing this since 2007 with a working capital of $100. She lives in a house made of bricks and zinc for a roof. She wants to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: To buy noodles, soft drinks, alcoholic drinks, and rice

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en: Natalia is 46 years old. She is married to a policeman, and she has 6 children with 5 of them in school: one is in primary school, one is in secondary school, and the other three are going to a university. She will use the loan to buy more needed items to keep in her store including beer, biscuits, candles, and rice. She opened her kiosk in 2008 with her own capital of $1,000. She has a garden to grow bananas, papayas, and vegetables. She wants her children to be well educated.

loans.use: To buy beer, biscuits, candles, and rice

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is a 49 year old woman and a mother of four children who are still in school. They live in Bohol, Philippines. Remedios and her husband have been fish vendors for more than 22 years now. This is the source of their income.

Remedios is in need of additional capital for her business. She is requesting a loan worth 30000PHP to buy more fish to sell and for the school expenses of her children. With this, she will be able to sell more fish to people in their community.

Remedios dreams of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to augment her income so that she will be able to provide for the needs of the family, especially the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell and for the school expenses of her children.

loans.name: Juana Inocencia

texts.es: Juana Inocencia de   42 años de edad, con dos hijos menores de edad, tiene por actividad económica un pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, ya que el punto de su negocio le ha resultado muy favorecedor porque al frente de su casa está un empresa procesadora de maní, experiencia en dicha actividad dos años, el objetivo del préstamo es para invertir en mercadería como: gaseosas, frescos naturales, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos, sal, detergentes, jugos, galletas, repostería entre otros.
texts.en:
Juana Inocencia is 42 years old and has two dependent children.  As her main source of income, she has a small grocery located in her home.  Already, the effects of her business have been favorable because her house faces a peanut processing facility, and she has two years of experience in this business.

The goal of her loan is the invest in merchandise like sodas, natural refreshments, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, salt, detergent, juices, cookies, and confectioneries among other things.

loans.use: to buy sodas, natural refreshments, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, salt, detergent, juices, cookies, and confectioneries among other things.

loans.name: Teodoro Armando

texts.es: Teodoro   Armando de  43 años de edad, con tres hijos mayores de edad, tiene por actividad  económica la venta de granos básico y servicio de reparación de zapatos,  tiene  4 años de experiencia en el negocio, el cual lo tiene ubicado en el mercado de su localidad, el negocio consiste en la vetan de granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles, maíz, cereales, azúcar, aceite, jabón, detergentes, entre otros. Teodoro  Armando siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona responsable, trabajadora, con solvencia de pago, en la actualidad está solicitando el financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo y obtener más ingresos de sus ventas, y satisfacer  la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Teodoro Armando is 43 years old with three adult children. He sells basic grains and repairs shoes. He has 4 years of experience in this business. His business is located in the local marketplace. The business consists in the sale of basic staples such as rice, beans, corn, cereals, sugar, oil, soap, and detergent, among others. 

Teodoro Armando has always been characterized as being a responsible, hard working person with sound payment. Today he is asking the loan to invest in working capital and to obtain more profits from his sales, and to satisfy the demand of his clients.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, corn, cereals, sugar, oil, soap, and detergent, among others.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge compró materiales e insumos con los cuales aumentó su oferta de productos y sus ventas, adicionalmente reparó los carros de comidas rápidas, e invirtió en un paragua para resguardarse de la lluvia y el inclemente sol, que acompaña a la hermosa e histórica ciudad de Cartagena de Indias. En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva,   recurso  con el cual quiere hacer varias inversiones, por un lado invertirá  nuevamente en materias primas e insumos de alimentos,  con los cuales continuará aumentando  su capital de trabajo; también reparará su vitrina, ofreciendo así una buena imagen de calidad de su negocio y finalmente comprará una lavadora mas, para adicionar a su negocio el de lavandería. En su expresión de agradecimiento por este soporte financiero, pide a los financiadores de Kiva que continúen apoyándolo. Su negocio tiene mucho potencial de crecimiento y esto es lo que finalmente lo llevará poco a poco a conseguir el sueño de prosperidad que no es otro que tener su propia casa para estabilizar totalmente su vida familiar.
texts.en:
With his previous loan, Jorge bought materials and food supplies with which he expanded his product offering and his sales. He also repaired his fast food cars and invested in an umbrella to protect himself from the rain and inclement sun that accompany life in the beautiful and historic city of Cartagena de Indias. Currently, he is applying for a new loan, which he wants to use in a variety of ways. On the one hand he will invest again in primary materials and food supplies with which he will continue increasing his work capital; he will also repair his display window, offering in this way a better quality image of his business; and finally he will buy another washer, in order to add laundry services to his business. 

In his expression of gratitude for this financial support, he asks that Kiva lenders continue supporting him. His business has a great deal of potential for growth, and it is this which will ultimately carry him little by little towards achieving his dream of prosperity, which is simply to have his own house in order to stabilize his family life.

loans.use: to invest in primary materials and food supplies, to repair his display case, and finally to buy another washer to add laundry services to his business.

loans.name: Inti Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “INTI” iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por Ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Verónica es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: cotilloneria, venta de comida, carpintería, venta de ladrillos, venta de celulares, venta de dulces y salón de belleza, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Verónica es una integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de celulares mismo que aprendió de su hermano hace varios años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de celulares) que comprará de las ferias tradicionales de La Paz y posteriormente comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella iniciará su familia con su pareja este mes.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el seguro que brinda la institución.
texts.en:
The A.C. “INTI” will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Via Exaltación center.  It’s made up of 8 members and is run by a board where Veronica is the secretary.  There is a variety of businesses that the communal association members have, such as: decorations, food sales, carpentry, brick sales, cell phone sales, sweets sales, a beauty shop and food sales.
The loan that they will take will help the small micro entrepreneurs where Veronica is a member.  She tells us that she started with Pro Mujer a year ago by an invitation from a friend who is a member.  She now has a cell phone business that she was taught by her brother some years ago.

She will use the loan to increase her working capital (to buy cell phones) that she will purchase in the traditional markets in La Paz and will later sell in a stand.  This type of work allows her to generate income when she can for her family.  She will start a family with her partner in a month.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she tells us that she likes the training and the security that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy cell phones

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El Sr. Edgar de 23 años de edad es casado y tiene dos hijos pequeños, el trabaja en un cine de la localidad y su esposa es ama de casa. Es un matrimonio joven y es por eso que quieren generar más ingresos para brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida. El está solicitando de nuestra ayuda para la compra de ropa de segunda mano.
texts.en: Edgar is 23 years old. He is married and has two small children. He works in a theater in town and his wife is a housewife. They are a young couple and that is why they want to generate more income to offer their chidlren a better quality of life. He is asking for our help to buy second hand clothing.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is a 30-year-old married woman and a mother of two young children. She runs a retailing business in their place in Bohol, Philippines. She sells household materials such as basins, slippers, kitchen utensils and other items. Moreover she is also in the hog raising business.

Ana Marie is requesting a loan worth 16000PHP to buy additional inventory to sell in her store such as household materials and additonal piglets to raise. She is optimistic that this loan could make her business sustainable and productive.

Ana Marie hopes to expand her business in the future to generate more income. In addition to this, she wants to save for the future schooling of her two young children.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory to sell in her store such as household materials and additonal piglets to raise.

loans.name: Franz Fidel

texts.es: El Sr. Franz tiene 24 años,  casado con 1 hijo bebe,  el artesanía en bronce (realiza escudos y broches para distintas instituciones, colegios, etc.) este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Franz va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material para la fabricación de artesanías y también para una impresora para negativos  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es ampliar su negocio y su independencia de servicios ajenos (impresión de negativos), el Sr. Franz enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios para responder a nuevos pedidos con más rapidez e independencia su  sueño para su negocio es tener una tienda de artesanías de bronce y un servicio de filmación.
texts.en: Franz is 24 years old and is married with one infant son.  He makes bronze handicrafts (he makes badges and brooches for different institutions, schools, etc.). This loan is the his loan with the institution. Franz is going to use this loan for the purchase of material for making crafts and also for a printer for negatives.  His reason for requesting this loan is to grow his business and his independence from services of others (printing negatives). Franz faces a challenge in his business which is competition. He is going to use the profits to respond to new orders with more speed and independence. His dream for his business is to have a store for bronze handicrafts and filming service.

loans.use: to purchase material for bronze handicrafts (badges and brooches)

loans.name: Vicuñitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VICUÑITAS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eusebia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras, venta de ropa usada, venta de cosméticos, venta de dulces por mayor, tejido de chompas y venta de lana de alpaca, tejido de mantas, ten de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Eusebia es una integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; cuenta que  este emprendimiento lo aprendió de su madre y posteriormente lo inicio ella sola.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para incremento de capital (compra de lana) mismo que adquirirá de las empresas distribuidoras y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializa a las galerías a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención y las capacitaciones en salud y ahorros.

En la fotografía podemos observar a la señoraque esta sentada con un niño, ella es la prima de la señora Catalina, que acompaña al grupo.
texts.en:
The communal association "Vicuñitas" will begin its sixth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Focal de Juan Pablo II. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Eusebia is the president. Members of this association maintain a variety of businesses. Among them we have: the sale of vegetables, sale of used clothing, sale of cosmetics, sale of wholesale candies, sweater-weaving and the sale of alpaca wool, blanket-weaving, and a food shop.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small microbusinesses, among them Eusebia's. She indicates that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for six months, joining by invitation from a friend who was a member of the organization. Currently, she has a blanket-weaving business. She tells us that she learned this trade from her mother and subsequently began the business on her own.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital (through the purchase of wool), which she will acquire from distributors. After making the blankets, she will sell them in galleries by request. This form of work allows her to generate income to support her family, since she lives with her partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Eusebia responded that she likes the attention and the health and income  management training.

In the photograph, we can see a woman sitting with a child—this is Catalina's cousin who often accompanies the group.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: Esmeralda Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESMERALDA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ana Gabriel es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de frutas, venta de artefactos, costura de edredones, venta de comida, venta de ropa, confección de chompas, taller de costura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ana Gabriel es una integrante, ella indica que es hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de unas amigas que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a que este negocio lo adquirió de su madre desde niña y en la actualidad ella realiza este emprendimiento para su subsistencia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para la ampliación del negocio (compra de muebles) mismo que adquiere de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de comercialización. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el apoyo de la institución.
texts.en: Communal bank Esmeralda will start its first cycle with field partner Pro Mujer, as part of the specific programme for the neighbourhood of Villa Tejada. The group is made up of seven members, with Ana Gabriel being president of the board. The women of the group have different types of businesses: fruit sales, electronics sales, eiderdown sewing, food sales, clothes sales, making alpaca-wool jumpers, sewing workshop. Ana Gabriel is one of these microentrepreneurs who will benefit from the loan. She says that she has been working with field partner Pro Mujer for six years; she joined on an invitation from one of her friends, who also works with them. Ana Gabriel sells food. She learned the trade from her mother when she was little and it is now her main source of income. She takes out this loan in order to buy furniture to improve her business. Indeed, for now she sells food at the street markets in the town of El Alto, but she will ultimately use the furniture for her shop. Her business helps her generate income to help her family as much as possible, for she is single and has a son. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes feeling supported by an institution.

loans.use: to buy furniture.

loans.name: Raquel De La Concepcion

texts.es: Raquel de la concepción de  43 años, soltera con , con 5 hijos de los cuales 2 son menores de edad los cuales están bajo su responsabilidad, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación , el tiempo de tener el negocio 4 años, la iniciativa de trabajo surgió como un medio de obtener un ingreso para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia , el financiamiento lo está solicitando para comprar productos de consumo diario como: azúcar, te, arroz, frijoles, aceite, pastas, sopa maruchan sopas maggi, leche, tiste, cuajada, refrescos naturales, entre otros.
texts.en:
Raquel de la Concepción is 43 years old. She is single and has five children, two of whom are minors and are in her care. She has a store located in her home. 

She has had her business for four years. This work initiative came about as a means of obtaining an income to improve her family's quality of life. 

The loan she is applying for is to buy sugar, tea, rice, beans, cooking oil, pastas, packaged soups, milk, tiste (beverage made from corn and chocolate), curd, natural fruit drinks and other items.

loans.use: To buy sugar, tea, rice, beans, cooking oil, pastas, packaged soups, milk, tiste (beverage made from corn and chocolate), curd, natural fruit drinks and other items.

loans.name: Jesus Fernando

texts.es: El Sr. Jesús Fernando de 41 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijos que aun son dependientes económicos. Ellos están estudiando y sus padres se esfuerzan por darles lo mejor. Jesús y su esposa están trabajando en una fábrica de la localidad. El es una persona muy trabajadora y siempre se esfuerza por dar ese algo más que lo que le piden, es un hombre muy responsable un muy buen esposo y es un padre muy cariñoso que solo quiere brindarle a su familia una calidad de vida excelente. Es por eso que en esta ocasión pide de nuestra ayuda para realizar trabajos exteriores en su domicilio como lo es enjarrar, porque quiere que el día de mañana sus hijos tenga un buen patrimonio.
texts.en: Jesús Fernando is 41 years old, married, and has 3 children who are his economic dependents. They are studying and their parents strive to give them the best. Jesús and his wife are working in a factory in the area. He is a very hardworking person and always strives to give something more than what they ask. He is a very responsible man, a very good husband and is a very caring father who only wants to offer his family an excellent quality of life. Because of this, at this time he asks our help to do exterior work on his home, which is to plaster, because he wants his children have a good estate tomorrow.

loans.use: to plaster his home

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: El negocio de Rocio nació, cuando su abuela de oficio confeccionista  y siempre preocupada porque sus nietas aprendieran el arte de la costura, las sentaba a su lado en el desarrollo de esa tarea; así fue como Rocio aprendió empíricamente a cortar  telas y a plasmar en  ellas,  las modas que tenía en su mente; como  Rocio fue la única de las nietas que avanzo en las costuras, termino siendo socia de su abuela ,y cuando empezaron a aparecer quebrantos de salud en su abuela, esta  regalo a Rocio las máquinas de coser, la fileteadora y herramientas de trabajo, con los que en la actualidad trabaja en su propio taller de confecciones, donde fabrica ropa para damas, caballeros e infantil y genera los ingresos para apoyar el bienestar de su hijo de 2 años, con quien sueña verlo convertida en un profesional de mucho éxito. Ella a sus 27 años de edad y  4 años de tener este negocio,  planea día a día su crecimiento, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para lograr su propósito rápidamente. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que invertirá en la compra de telas variadas, materia prima e insumos para poder producir ropa a todo costo, y con ello  obtener mayores ganancias en sus productos y  aportarle mucho más los gastos de su hogar. Por eso se esmera en trabajar persistentemente, para mejorar el desempeño de sus operaciones y ofrecer productos de mucha calidad;  en la actualidad sus clientes  llevan su tela y escogen el modelo a producir, mientras Rocio corta, prepara, ensambla y acaba el producto de acuerdo a las medidas de cada cliente; sus ventas las realiza de contado, utilizando revistas de moda de donde  sus clientes escogen la moda que mas les gusta y con las que Rocio los complace.
texts.en: Rocio's business was born because of her grandmother. She was a seamstress by trade and always taking care that her granddaughters learned the art of sewing. She would put them beside her when she did her tasks. That is how Rocio learned empirically how to cut fabrics and express herself in them with the styles she had in mind. Since Rocio was the only one of the granddaughters who advanced in sewing, she ended up being her grandmother's partner. When her grandmother started having health problems. she gave Rocio the sewing machines, the overstich machine and her work tools. She uses these to work in her own sewing workshop where she makes clothes for women, men and children. She generates income to support the wellbeing of her 2 year old son. She dreams of seeing him become a person with a succesful career. At 27 years old and with 4 years with this business, she plans her day to day growth. She doesn'y have enough working capital to achieve her goal quickly. That is why she is turning now to a Kiva loan, the first loan he has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it, she will invest in buying various fabrics, raw materials and more to be able to produce clothes of all prices and thus obtain more earnings for her products and contribute much more to the household expenses. That is why she works so persistently to improve her operational performance and offer high quality products. Right now her customers bring the fabric and choose the model to produce, and Rocio cuts, prepares and assembles the product according to each customer's measurements. She sells up front, using fashion magazines where her customers choose the style they like the most and Rocio complies.

loans.use: to buy various fabrics, raw materials and more materials.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 23 years old. She is getting married to a man who works for the government (government staff) and she has a child. She will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan including sugar, coffee, soft drinks, hard drinks and rice. 

She has enough land to cultivate banana, papaya and vegetables. She lives in a house made of bricks and zinc for the roof. She opened her kiosk in 2006 with her own capital of $500.00. She wants to open a big store and she wants to send her child to get  a good education.  She also wants to buy a car in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, coffee, soft drinks, hard drinks and rice.

loans.name: Kpessou Group

texts.fr: KPESSOU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amies unies par un lien de parenté. La représentante du groupe, Afiavi Marie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 58 ans et est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Eugène. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont aucun n’est plus à leur charge. Afiavi Marie vit ensemble avec son mari. Afiavi Marie assure avec son mari, les diverses charges de la maison. Depuis près de douze ans, Afiavi Marie vend de la nourriture à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Afiavi Marie vend des biscuits et divers produits. Afiavi Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Afiavi Marie et les autres membres du groupe KPESSOU sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
KPESSOU is a group of three persons whose members are friends united by ties of kinship. The group's representative, Afiavi Marie (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 58 years old and married to a retailer named Eugène. The couple have four children, all in school. None of the children are dependents. Afiavi Marie lives together with her husband. Along with him, she ensures that the diverse household expenses are covered

For nearly eleven years, Afiavi Marie has been selling food out of her home. Parallel to this business, she sells cookies and a variety of goods. She gets her supplies from a market in Benin.

This is the first time that Afiavi Marie and the other members of the group KPESSOU have requested financial support from ALIDé to bolster their working capital and their businesses and to respond further to the requirements of their customers.

loans.use: to buy cookies and condiments

loans.name: Lauro

texts.es:
Lauro tiene 62 años, está casado con Tomasa, de 65 años, tienen tres hijos.
Lauro se siente muy contento con la actividad que realiza, pues después de trabajar como un jornalero durante muchos años, ahora es dueño de su propio terreno agrícola; a pesar de los problemas sacó fuerzas para darle una mejor vida a su familia, es por ello que ahora se dedica por entero al cultivo de cacao. Regularmente recibe la ayuda de su esposa e hijos familia, pero por lo general, en temporadas de cosecha tiene a cargo peones para que agilicen la extracción de su producto. Su cacao lo vende en los centros de acopio de su comunidad, donde obtiene un precio justo por cada kilo. En el futuro anhela extender su chacra y tener más hectáreas para incrementar su producción.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además agradece la confianza que le está otorgando su banco comunal.
Con este préstamo comprará más plantas de cacao para cultivarlas en las partes que aun tiene vacías en sus tierras.
texts.en:
Lauro is 62 years old. He is married to Tomasa, 65, and they have three children.

Lauro feels very happy with the work he does, as after working as a day laborer for many years, he is now the owner of his own farmland. Despite the problems, he mustered up the strength to give his family a better life. This is why he devotes himself entirely to growing coffee. 

He receives help on a regular basis from his wife and children, but normally at the harvest seasons he hires laborers to speed up the harvest of his crop. He sells his cacao at the collection centers in his community, where he gets a fair price for each kilo. 

In the future he greatly desires to expand his small farm and have more hectares, in order to increase his production. 

This is his first loan with MFP, so he promises to make the respective payments faithfully. In addition, he appreciates the trust that his communal bank is granting him. 

With this loan, he will more buy more cacao plants, in order to grow them in the portions of his land that are still unplanted.

loans.use: To buy more cacao plants, in order to grow them in the portions of his land that are still unplanted.

loans.name: Cruz Jesus

texts.es: El Sr. cruz Jesús es casado y de 41 años, desde hace mas de 12 años vive en casa de interés social, el Sr. Cruz es empleado de una maquiladora de la localidad en la cual cuenta con una antigüedad de 10 años, teniendo como horario de lunes a viernes de 7:00 am a 5:00 pm, y los fines de semana realiza trabajos de plomería, electricidad y mecánica. El quiere ampliar su casa y proporcionarle a su familia un mejor estilo de vida, cómodo y privado a la vez, su esposa como ama de casa le ayuda con detalles en la casa, lo cual impulsa a su marido a seguir adelante trabajando con mucho esfuerzo. Solicita crédito para ampliar cuarto en planta baja.
texts.en: Cruz Jesús is married and is 41 years old. For more than 12 years, he has lived in publicly subsidized housing. Cruz is an employee of an assembly plant in the area, and has worked there for 10 years. He has a schedule of Monday to Friday from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm. On the weekends, he does plumbing, electrical, and mechanical work.
